text: Li Keqiang (; 1 July 1955 – 27 October 2023) was a Chinese politician and economist. He became the Premier of the People's Republic of China and party secretary of the State Council in 2013. He ranked #2 in Chinese power structure from 2012 until his death in 2023, next to Xi Jinping. Li graduated from Beijing University, with a Bachelor degree in Law, PhD degree in Economics. He joined the Communist Party of China (CPC) in May 1976. He became a member of the CPC Central Committee in 1997 and retained the membership since then. He’s also written articles using the name Eldon Li. On 27 October 2023, Li died from a heart attack while he was on a holiday in Shanghai. ==References== ==Other websites== * Profile Category:1955 births Category:Premiers of the People's Republic of China Category:Chinese economists Category:Vice Premiers of the People's Republic of China Category:People from Anhui Category:2023 deaths
title: Li Keqiang
